description._content: Map title: The Groundplot of George Worrell's premises, Campbelltown; with the adjoining Lands, as far as appears to be connected with the Death of Frederick Fisher. This map is part of NRS 292: Papers relating to the prosecution by the Attorney General, of George Worrell for the murder of Frederick Fisher at Campbelltown. Go to Advanced Search -> Record Series (292) The documents comprise depositions, evidence and exhibits submitted before the Campbelltown Bench of Magistrates and correspondence and notes made before the then Acting Attorney General (W.H. Moore) regarding the case. The papers apparently represent Moore's brief for the case, which was heard before the Supreme Court at Campbelltown on 2 February 1827. We'd love to hear from you if you use our photos/documents.

note._content: This line: "11 Chains 95 links from where the Body was found to the corner of the Fence where the Blood is to be seen"
note.author: 27331537@N06

note._content: This line: 12 Chains from Dunghill onto the hole G in which the Body of F Fisher was found
note.author: 27331537@N06

note._content: These two lines: Between 7 and 8 chains of this line from the Fence, appears to be a road made by Carting Wheat fr off the Land: the remainder of the way, a trodden path
note.author: 27331537@N06

note._content: This line: the direction in which G Worrell said he traced blood, to the corner of the Fence. 12 Chain 10 Links
note.author: 27331537@N06
